CONJUGATES: bandages (n. pl.) | bandaging (v. pres. p.) | bandaged (v. pt. pp.)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle French *bandage*, derived from *bande* (strip, band) + *-age* (suffix indicating action or result).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A long strip of cloth or other material used to bind up a wound, protect an injury, or hold a dressing in place.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用于包扎伤口、保护受伤部位或固定敷料的长条布料或其他材料；绷带。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She needed to change the bandage on her knee every day.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她需要每天更换膝盖上的绷带。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To cover, bind, or dress a wound or an injured part of the body with a strip of material.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用绷带包扎（伤口或受伤的身体部位）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The nurse quickly bandaged the cut on his arm.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 护士迅速包扎了他手臂上的伤口。
